Column Comment.0: INSPECTION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this quality inspection.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.3: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.4: INSPECTED LENGTH: The length of the seismic inspection.
Column Comment.6: INSPECTING BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: The identifier who is the business associatethis is inspecting the data set.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: INSPECTION STATUS: The status of this inspection, such as completed, waiting onapproval, waiting for client decision etc.
Column Comment.9: INSPECTION ADDRESS OBS NO: part of the foreign key indicating the address atwhich the inspection is to occur.
Column Comment.10: INSPECTION ADDRESS BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: part of the foreign key indicatingthe address at which the inspection is to occur.
Column Comment.11: INSPECTION ADDRESS SOURCE: part of the foreign key indicating the address atwhich the inspection is to occur.
Column Comment.12: MINIMUM LENGTH: the minimum length that the business associate has access to.
Column Comment.14: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.15: SEISMIC AUTHORIZATION REASON: the reason why this authorization wasgranted, such as legislated, area not of interest, old data etc.
Column Comment.16: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.17: SCHEDULED DATE: the date that the inspection is scheduled for.
Column Comment.18: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
